examples: A true leader walks the talk.
The old lady walked slowly with the support of her cane.
The father proudly walked his daughter down the aisle on her wedding day.
They walk their dogs every day.
She walked the horse around the ring.
words.defineEn: to move forward at a regular speed by placing our feet in front of each other one by one
words.defineVi: di chuyển về phía trước với tốc độ đều đặn bằng cách đặt chân của chúng ta trước mặt nhau từng cái một

examples: The local bus company only runs a skeleton service on Sundays.
The college runs summer courses for foreign students.
The college also runs evening classes in bricklaying and joinery.
The bookcase runs the length of the room.
The tabloid press ran the story.
words.defineEn: to move using our legs, faster than we usually walk, in a way that both feet are never on the ground at the same time
words.defineVi: di chuyển bằng chân, nhanh hơn chúng ta thường đi bộ, theo cách mà cả hai chân không bao giờ chạm đất cùng một lúc

examples: The Siemens display goes the whole hog.
The cruise went very quickly.
My laptop went haywire
To go swimming/fishing/jogging.
The email went to everyone in the company.
words.defineEn: to travel or move from one location to another location
words.defineVi: để đi du lịch hoặc di chuyển từ một địa điểm đến một địa điểm khác

examples: His family comes first.
Knowledge of cooking comes easy to him.
Come rain or shine.
After dinner comes the reckoning.
All good things come to an end.
words.defineEn: to move or travel toward something or someone
words.defineVi: để di chuyển hoặc đi về phía một cái gì đó hoặc một ai đó

examples: The farm sits in the shadow of Ben Nevis.
Candidates will sit the examinations in June.
She sits her horse gracefully.
A large bus was sitting outside.
The new policy sits well with the company's values.
words.defineEn: to be in or on a chair or seat, or on the ground, resting our weight on our bottom with a straight back
words.defineVi: ở trong hoặc trên ghế hoặc ghế ngồi, hoặc trên mặt đất, dồn trọng lượng của chúng ta xuống mông với lưng thẳng

examples: Shergar film falls at the first fence in Cannes.
Underneath the orange tree, the leaves gently fall.
The fall knocked the wind out of me.
The leaves fall from the trees in autumn.
People are falling like flies from COVID-19.
words.defineEn: to quickly move from a high place toward the ground
words.defineVi: để nhanh chóng di chuyển từ một nơi cao xuống đất

examples: The car ahead of me jumped the light.
The child jumped up and down with excitement.
My cat jumped onto the kitchen counter.
He jumped the queue at the ticket counter.
The squirrel jumped from one tree branch to another.
words.defineEn: to push yourself off the ground or away from something and up into the air by using your legs and feet
words.defineVi: để đẩy mình lên khỏi mặt đất hoặc ra khỏi một cái gì đó và bay lên không trung bằng cách sử dụng chân và bàn chân của bạn

examples: Bad weather brought chaos to the utility companies.
The day brings a sense of vitality and liveliness to the world.
The bad weather brought famine.
The revolution brought many changes.
Retirement often brings with it a massive drop in income.
words.defineEn: to take someone or something to a place or to come to a place with someone or something
words.defineVi: đưa ai đó hoặc cái gì đó đến một nơi hoặc đến một nơi với ai đó hoặc cái gì đó

examples: A touch of maple extract in the pancake batter gives them a delightful maple syrup taste.
The finance minister's fall from grace gave his enemies great satisfaction.
Give sweetsop a try!
The morgue gives me the jitters.
This old house gives me the willies.
words.defineEn: to offer a thing to a person
words.defineVi: để cung cấp một điều cho một người

examples: Find a hobby.
After all, love will find a way.
Water will always find its own level.
She found a dirty stain on her favorite shirt.
The court found in her favor.
words.defineEn: to discover or get back something or someone that we had lost, after searching for it or them
words.defineVi: để khám phá hoặc lấy lại một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó mà chúng tôi đã mất, sau khi tìm kiếm nó hoặc họ

examples: The driver of the car opened the car door for the passengers.
The waiter opened the bottle of wine for the guests.
The library opens at 10 o'clock on weekdays.
right on cue the door opened
The store stays open late on Thursdays.
words.defineEn: to move something like a window or door into a position that people, things, etc. can pass through
words.defineVi: di chuyển thứ gì đó như cửa sổ hoặc cửa ra vào vào vị trí mà mọi người, đồ vật, v.v. có thể đi qua

examples: The shopkeeper closed the shop for a short break.
The police closed in.
The business has already closed the books for this quarter.
Detectives had closed the book on the Hornsey Murders case three years previously.
The library closes early on Sundays.
words.defineEn: to move something like a window or door into a position that people or things cannot pass through
words.defineVi: để di chuyển một cái gì đó như cửa sổ hoặc cửa ra vào một vị trí mà mọi người hoặc những thứ không thể đi qua

examples: She always pulls her weight.
Uh, I was just pulling your chain, man.
The caterer really pulled a rabbit out of a hat by producing 100 cupcakes with just 20 minutes' notice.
She pulls a face at her brother whenever he teases her.
She pulled her suitcase behind her as she walked through the airport.
words.defineEn: to use our hands to move something or someone toward us or in the direction that our hands are moving
words.defineVi: sử dụng bàn tay của chúng tôi để di chuyển một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó về phía chúng tôi hoặc theo hướng mà bàn tay của chúng tôi đang di chuyển

examples: She pushed the stroller along the path in the park.
They pushed the heavy box across the room.
The weight of the world pushed him to his knees.
She pushed the cart down the aisle at the grocery store.
The new product design pushes the limits of what is currently available on the market.
words.defineEn: to use our hands, arms, body, etc. in order to make something or someone move forward or away from us
words.defineVi: sử dụng bàn tay, cánh tay, cơ thể của chúng ta, v.v. để làm cho một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó di chuyển về phía trước hoặc ra xa chúng ta

examples: What time does the show start?
Start the engines!
The school semester starts next month.
Who started the fire?
The trail starts just outside the town.
words.defineEn: to begin doing or using something that we were not doing or using before, and continue doing or using it
words.defineVi: để bắt đầu làm hoặc sử dụng một cái gì đó mà chúng tôi đã không làm hoặc sử dụng trước đó và tiếp tục làm hoặc sử dụng nó

examples: My watch has stopped.
The buck stops with him.
The car stopped at the traffic lights.
The team stopped the rot with a 5–0 win last night.
Doctors couldn't stop the bleeding.
words.defineEn: to make something or someone not move anymore
words.defineVi: để làm cho một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó không di chuyển nữa

examples: The team finished the race in first place.
You just finished your book?
She finishes her piano practice at 7 o'clock.
I've finished my work.
She always finishes her work assignments by the end of the week.
words.defineEn: to make something end
words.defineVi: để làm cho một cái gì đó kết thúc

examples: Robins build nests almost anywhere.
The birds built their nest in the tree.
She had built a reputation as a criminal lawyer.
The ironworks were built in 1736.
The houses are built out of local stone.
words.defineEn: to put together different materials such as brick to make a building, etc.
words.defineVi: để tập hợp các vật liệu khác nhau như gạch để tạo nên một tòa nhà, v.v.

examples: Does this pub do lunches?
Does this pub do lunches?
Does the price include tax?
Microprocessors do the calculations in the twinkling of an eye.
The gang did a warehouse and a supermarket.
words.defineEn: to perform an action or activity that is not mentioned by name
words.defineVi: để thực hiện một hành động hoặc hoạt động không được đề cập theo tên

examples: 95 per cent of the UK can now get superfast broadband.
This room gets very little sunshine.
Get a load of that dress Mag!
Get a load of George over there.
The police got wind of the illegal drug deal.
words.defineEn: to receive or come to have something
words.defineVi: để nhận hoặc đến để có một cái gì đó

examples: The sunflower turned its face towards the sun.
The victory turned the tide of the war in North Africa.
The thunder had turned the milk.
Police turned water cannon on the rioters.
Turn the mould upside down.
words.defineEn: to change the position of our body or part of our body in a way that we face a different direction
words.defineVi: để thay đổi vị trí của cơ thể hoặc một phần cơ thể của chúng ta theo cách mà chúng ta phải đối mặt với một hướng khác

examples: She introduced her husband as a successful entrepreneur during the charity event.
He introduced himself.
The bakery introduced a new pastry filled with raspberry jelly.
She introduced her friends to Vegemite sandwiches during a picnic.
She introduced her boyfriend to her parents during the family gathering.
words.defineEn: to tell someone our name so they can know us, or to tell them someone else's name so they can know each other, normally happening in the first meeting
words.defineVi: nói với ai đó tên của chúng tôi để họ có thể biết chúng tôi hoặc nói cho họ biết tên của người khác để họ có thể biết nhau, thường xảy ra trong lần gặp đầu tiên

examples: Travel broadens the mind.
The train traveled through beautiful countryside.
They travelled the highways and byways of Britain.
The news traveled across the country like lightning.
His travels brought him into contact with many famous artists.
words.defineEn: to go from one location to another, particularly to a far location
words.defineVi: đi từ địa điểm này sang địa điểm khác, đặc biệt là đến một địa điểm xa

examples: The support of our families has helped enormously.
Helping you?
Such helps were like drop in the ocean.
The taxi driver helped me with my luggage.
His help is useful as a chocolate teapot.
words.defineEn: to give someone what they need or to make doing something easier or possible for them
words.defineVi: để cung cấp cho ai đó những gì họ cần hoặc để làm điều gì đó dễ dàng hơn hoặc có thể cho họ

examples: I let the spare room.
Let A and B stand for X and Y respectively.
They let loose a couple of rounds of ammunition.
This lets more water into the soil.
The app lets you share your photos on Facebook, Twitter, and Tumblr.
words.defineEn: to allow something to happen or someone to do something
words.defineVi: để cho phép một cái gì đó xảy ra hoặc ai đó để làm một cái gì đó
